text: Bottle. Pours clear golden orange, small white head, some lacing. Aroma is Brett, basement, oak, sweat socks. Flake is dry and funky, oak. Light body. Good
@ Bjällerödsvägen 25/2-17. Bottle from Kihoskh, Copenhagen. Fruity and bretty with grapes and wood, also acidic. Body is medium, the finish is dry, tart, fruity, bretty and acidic with grapes.

Bottle. Hazy orange. Thin white head. Medium sourness, medium bitterness. Medium body. Aroma is meat, brandy, wood, brett, peach, hops, gunpowder. Flavour is brett, brandy, vanilla, citrus. Pretty. Balanced.

Bottle shared at Leightons place 31/05/2017. Many thanks to Scopey for this one. A hazed golden orange coloured pour with a fine white head. Aroma is sweet, tangy pineapple, funky lacto, clean sour, faint vinegar. Flavour is composed of medium sweet, grapefruit, spicy citrus, pineapple, low funk, . Palate is medium sweet, prickly carbonation, . Low funky. Nice complexity.
355 ml bottle from Belgoklubben. Hazy golden with white head. Funky with fruit,leather, earthy, leaves, citrus and grape skin. Dry medium sour with low carbonation.

Bottle split at Hackney Levels, thanks to Scopey, 31/05/17.
Lightly hazed golden orange with a decent light beige head.
Nose is pissy lemon, funk, grains, apple core, damp wood, damp cloth, spice.
Taste comprises funk, grains, barnyard, light fecal whisper, grape must, pissy citric shreds, earthy, green apple, rotting pear.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, drying close.
Solid gueuze action.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared at LKS. It pours clearish orange - amber with a medium white head. The aroma is fresh, sweet vanilla, oaky, funky, must, damp leaves, tangerine, candied orange, sherbet, chamomile, Granny Smith apple and gooseberry. The taste is drying, bitter, earthy, musty, funky, minerals, wood, pithy lemon, nectarine, tangerine, gooseberry, mild acidity, floral, chamomile, sherbet and some underlying sweetness. Medium body and fine, foamy carbonation. Interesting and quaffable.

Bottle shared in London - many thanks to Paul. Pours clear orange-gold with a creamy, white head. Nice aroma, a little musty, some old grass, tangerine. Medium sweet flavour with nice jammy citrus, mellow acidity, some woody tang, more tangerine. Medium to full bodied with average carbonation. Finishes with a little salty bite, ripe lemon and tangerine, more melon, subtle grass and a light drying woodiness.
Weicher trockener Antrunk mit hellmalzigen, intensiven Brettnoten. Trocken gewürzig, vollmundig, wenig Balsamico. 10/9/9/9//9

Bouteille 37.5cl.
Dorée virant sur léger orangée, voile moyen, col blanc.
Arôme offrant de belles effluves de barrique, léger funk, notes vertes avec petit côté dananas, fruité acerbe.
Palais est finement malté, grains, barrique avec un boisé modéré, touche de funk, ananas, citronné, finement acidulé, alcool même à 9% est plaisant, le tout finement râpeux avec une bonne effervescence. Fini sec, boisé et fruité.

Draft at Lambiczoon. Golden pour. Aroma of tart, hay, horseblanket, brett and dry apples. Flavor has horseblanket, dry funky barnyard, green apples, white grape and a nice dry bretty finish. Good stuff.

Bottle 375ml @ geokkjer
Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, funk, barnyard, horse blanket, grapefruit and hint of oak. Taste is light sweet and medium to heavy sour with a long dry, grapefruit, oak and funky finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle, 375ml. A lightly hazy golden colored beer with a minimal sized head. Its funky, leathery and barnyard-ish, with some horseblanket and wheat. Grapefruit juice. Oak. Its tart and full-bodied, with a decent carbonation. Not exactly smooth, but very pleasant on the palate. Its funky as hell on the palate, with grapefruit, barnyard, leather and oak. Lots of oak in the finish, with grapefruit, leather and some horseblanket. A wonderful beer indeed, especially love the oak touch. 170516
Bottle. Pours golden with an off-white head. Aroma of malt, spices, lemon, herbs and yeast. Flavor is sour and sweet with some grapes, grapefruit, lime and malt. Medium body, average carbonation.
375ml bottle. Hazy golden with a foamy white head. Flavors are bread, sweet cereals, apple and oak with funky notes. Medium to full body, moderate carbonation, smooth texture.
(Une bouteille provenant de Hi-Time Cellar): Moût de pomme, pulsions phénoliques, bouquet mentholé et une finale sèche et boisée. On croirait que ce liquide à déjà été une Tripel.
Bottle. Opaque golden color, white head. Appealing sour aroma with herbal notes. Complex flavor with citric notes, herbs, alcohol. Medium-full body, high carbonation. Very nice!

UPDATED: APR 16, 2017 Mooi goudblond bier met fijne witte parelende schuimkraag die snel vervaagt. Aroma van appel, cider, hooi, lichte "put"lucht. Mildzuur en heel zacht van smaak. Geen 9 % abv waarneembaar. Soepel met een mooie droge afdronk. Prima aperitief bier. Mooi.
Backlog. Pineapple, fruity, cheese, hay, oak. Moderate sour, tart. Great one!

Bottle 375ml. corked @ Gastropub Tuulensuu, Hämeenpuisto 23, Tampere, Finland 33210 . [ As Boon Oude Geuze VAT 79 ].Light unclear medium orange color with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, moderate to heavy yeaty, barnyard, leather, brett, farmhouse, apple - grapes, fruit. Flavor is moderate to light light heavy sweet and light acidic with a long duration, fruity, dried fruit, apple - grapes, funky, manure, sweet malt. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20160707]
 8-4-8-4-15

Bottle: Served in a Geuze glass:
Hazy orange body with a lasting creamy white head on top.
Nose of funk, wood, earthy, cellar, earthy cheese, old (lightly rotten) wood...
Flavour is vinous, light tart, earthy, old wood, hint of earthy cheese and mushrooms, cognac, tannines, strange funkyness...
Aftertaste is light tart, wood, earthy, light vinous and some funk...
Low carbo, creamy light tart mouthfeel, medium bodied.
Very decent but not completely balanced.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: A: Deep dark orange coloured with a big offwhite head N: Loads of tart green apples, sweet red apples and pear bashes out when popped. Funky, grapes, orange, some light spices, slightly boozy. T: Sweet. Mangostan, papaya, apples. O: Very promising nose, a bit dissapointing taste. Was expecting a tart and funky fruitbomb. This is sweet with some tropical fruits.
W aromacie dzikie i stajenne, ale delikatne. Smak to głównie wytrawność, ale zdecydowanie przełamana słodyczą. W ogólnym odczuciu dość gorzkie i wytrawne, lekkie, ciekawe.
Sweet and bitter with a slight sourness. Very low carbonation for Lambic. Strange but fun.
Very, very complex beer. An interesting bitterness that I cant place, some fruit notes, funk, and sourness. Very dry. Excellent.
Fles gedeeld met Benzai en TomHendriksen en Roelzie1986. Goudgeel helder bier. Aroma en smaak erg is zuur. Nasmaak is iets bitter.

Bottle @ tasting at TomHendriksen. Thanks for sharing. Clear orange golden color, small off-white head. Wonderful complex aroma of tannine, oak, fruity flavors. Taste has a moderate sourness, some tannine and oak with slight fruity flavors again. Pretty nice!

Fles gedeeld door Inoven, geprobeerd met Roelzie1986 en Benzai.
Het is een goudkleurig Geuzebier met weinig schuim. Het heeft (uiteraard) een zure smaak. Maar niet te overheersend.

Bottle @ DØE Tasting. Pours golden with an offwhite head. Aroma of light sourness, barnyard, wood, grapes, wine. Flavor is sour, light sweet, barnyard, wood, grapes, tart fruit, citrus, lemonpeel. Medium body, average carbonation, sweet and light acidic finish. 150317

Panelowo Rami Rami is drinking an Oude Geuze Boon à lAncienne - Vat 79 Mono Blend by Brouwerij Boon at Saska Kępa

Klasycznie, pozatym ze pojawia sie jablko i cos slodkiego jeszcze, baaaardzo przyjemny

Bottled. Dark golden coloured. Unclear. Dense light beige head. Aroma. Sourness, barnyard, leather, funk, rarth. Flavour. Funk, sourness, earth, horseblanket, barnyard. Medium to full bodied. Ends sour and funky.
Zapach owocowy, trochę brety, trochę szampan. W smaku średnia kwaśność z dosyć sporą słodkością, trochę winogronowej skórki.

Bottle from Mikkeller Webshop. Clear golden with a small white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, lemon, barnyard and wood. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. A bit sweet and strong for a geuze. 150317

Bottle courtesy of kraddel, side by side with Vat 77, thanks! Clear golden color, thick white head with good retention, champagne bubbles. Aroma of light funk, subtle fruit. Taste is more fruity, soft sourness, light dust. Very nice. My 100th gueuze rating.
Bottle - Funky white grape and some petroleum notes. Clear gold with a decent white head. Caramel funky malts, apple, white grape. Funky but not very acidic which makes it very easy to drink.
375ml bottle pours out a hazy cloudy gold topped with a white head. Nose is dusty cellar plastic rubber. Taste more of the cellar dust barrel notes some tart notes. Very nice.

March 3, 2017. Bottle at home. 
Clear dark golden with a one inch white head. Aroma is fruity, slightly sweet, malty and cheesy funk with apples, both baked and skins, light malty notes, oak, barnyard and hay. 
Taste is light tart, funky, slight sweetness. Medium bodied, soft to average small bubble carbonation. Finish is slightly bitter with a light astringency, some warming alcohol, sour apple cart, wood and hints of barnyard. 
Good but a bit too much astringency in the finish.
Sour nose, nice looks and very sour taste. Yeasty but not agreeable at all. Well not for me.

Refrigerated 11.2 oz bottle corked and capped poured into a tulip. Clear light orange with medium off-white head. Aroma is tart, medium/light body, medium carbonation, and pretty good lacing. Taste is tart, some wood, and light citrus.

Bottle. Darker golden in color with a whitish head. Tart fruityness, some sweetness and grainyness in aroma. Some barnyard and ripe pears too. Bit tart mouthfeel. Really nice. Mild tartness, sweetness and barnyard in taste. Some crunchy grainyness and mild vinous notes in finish, okay though. Easy drinking stuff despite the boozy stingy part.

Bottle from Mikkeller web shop cons 2017-02-12 Göteborg 
AR: sweet yeasty, tart, white grapes, sour gooseberries 
AP: bronze clear, fluffy white head
F: rich carbonated, white grapes, tartness, sour gooseberries, sweet mouthfeeling, elegance

Bottle, [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Kolding. Pours clear amber golden with a small, creamy white head. Aroma has sharp green apple, funk, light vinious. Medium carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has tartness, green apple, very oaky dry. Very lovely.
Wicked Odense Rating Party. Cloudy orange with a small white head. Bready and herbal aroma, with old wood and hay. Sweet and tart malty flavour with a touch of alcohol
Bottle @ Scheffels Otha fish in the sea Tasting. Pours Hazy deep golden with a off white head. Marzipan, manuer, cow web, caramel. Tartish dry finish.

Bottle. @ Pours hazy orange with a white head. Aroma of vinegar, funk, manure, hay, sweet tones of something liqour, citrus. Taste is rather heavy sweet, loads of funk and citrus, light stones fruits, quite malty.

375ml bottle. Golden colour, white foam head leaving lacing and aroma of citrus rind, wood, funk. Taste is tangy, citrus lemon rind, funk, woody and boozy. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry woody finish. Quite drinkable.

opalescent orange colour, minimal off-white head, aroma of barnyard, wine cellary, lemony and vinegar notes, wood barrel and fruitiness, taste of balsamic vinegar, lemony notes, bread, maybe some unripe apple and bitterness, as well as some syrupy sweetness in the back; great gueuze! Many thanks, kapusil!

0.375l bottle. Hazy orange body with a thin white head. Aroma of bread, lemon zest, vinegar and salt. Taste of bread, salt, lemon juice, vinegar, lime and grapefruit. Maybe fresher and has a bit more brett character than the 109. Great geuze.

37cl bottle. Clear golden pour with a white head and visible carbonation. Notes of barnyard funk, apple cider, macerated white grapes, apricots, citrus, light apple vinegar. Dry and refreshing, champagne-like, also due to the higher (by lambic standards) ABV value.
An amazing beer , it has a light gueuze aroma, and a slight sour finish, but it also has the layers of complexity of a DIPA . Brilliant .

Bottled. Pours slightly hazy deep golden with a small white head. Aroma of peach, ripe apples, funk and barnyard. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up being dry and tart. Medium bodied,watery to oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice Gueuze indeed. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

Bottle @ Mig & Ølsnedkeren shared with Nick, 9%. clear golden with tiny off-whitehead. Aroma is malt, little funk, tart and barnyard. flavour is malt, little funk, medium sweet, grapefruit, little wood, little lemon and a little sour.

37.5cl corked and caged bottle, via Etre. It pours a rich golden color with a large fluffy white head. Aroma is wonderfully complex with a strong barrel note, cognac-like. Also notes of mature funk, cheese, lemon juice, horse blanket, baked apples. Taste is also rich and well rounded with a significant amount of balancing warming sweetness, wood, cognac, more apricots and apples, lemon meringue and funk. Medium to full bodied with good carbonation. Overall, loved it

Bottle shared by Mathieu Robichaud, thanks mate! Pours a hazy golden with a white rim that leaves some lacing. Nose is of oak and the usual barnyard funk but this time there is some extra cheesy funk too. Taste is surprisingly a little sweet (off-dry) with tart apples and more oak. Average body and carbonation for the style. Another nice Boon VAT, not sure about that slight underattenuation/sweetness impression, though.

Bottle from Alko. Hazy orange color, white head. Sour taste with citrus, wheat, tart, ripe fruits, a bit of sour apple, oak and acidic notes. Sour finish with citrus, wheat, ripe fruits, a bit of alcohol, oak and tart. Excellent gueuze.

Bottle 375ml (Beer Hunters). Clear amber color, medium-sized white head. Earthy, fruity geuze nose. Medium-bodied. Smooth, "easy" gueze with very fruity taste profile - even sherryish sweetness there but same time lambic tartness is present. White wineous. This is not hardcore Boon... drinkability is good.

Bottle 375ml. Thx Mathieu.
Pours hazy orange with low white head. Aroma is of funk, citrus, bretts. Taste is of fruits, citrus, wood, acidity, sweetness. Palate: Full bodied, soft carbonation. Overall: Very good, but a tad too sweet.

bottle shared by benjamin, thanks bro! pours unclear medium dark but bright golden with a small white cap offering some retention and nice lacing. apricot juice, oak tannins, astringent herbs, light acidity - complex boon flora, definitely funky; peppery wheat, old grassiness, salt, minerals. moderate carbonation, medium body - oily; semi-sweet grassy-tannic finish. what high gravity lambic should be - no offense jean.

Bottle (375 ml), shared by Benjamin. Hazy dark orangey with a small white head leaving little lacing. Aroma is quite lambic funk forward with some manure notes, oak, mild spiciness and citrusy notes. Taste is funky with oak, manure notes, moderate spiciness, citrus and a bit of alcohol. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Oaky and citrusy finish. Heavy but fun and unique gueuze.

Bottle shared. Hazy gold pour with nice foamy white head. Aroma is super fecal, really nice funk, light cheesy notes. Taste is funky, tart nice farmyard notes. Palate is med full bodied, light sweetness, good carbonation. Nice.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2017 Aroma of apples, gooseberry, lime, a bit of barnyard, herbs, feels very fresh
Taste is much better, sourness isnt overwhelming, flavors are complex, with grapefruit in the front, which i didnt expect. a bit of pleasant astringency, no flavor or smell of alcohol at all
Drank again, re-rating.
Bottle. Pours a golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity sour woody funky aroma. Fruity sour tart funky woody flavor. Has a fruity sour tart funky woody finish.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

375ml bottle. Golden yellow colour. Thin white head. Funky, barnyard, acidic notes, vinegar, hinch of peaches in the aroma. Spicy, funky at first. Acidic notes. Woody notes. Hints of fruits. Sour, oakie finish. Spicy, funky aftertaste. Definitely has more body than usual gueuze. Rather low carbonated, not so refreshing, rather bitter brew.

Dark orange color with slight white head. Apricots, apples, dried leaves, medium mouthfeel for a gueuze. Medium sweetness. Still a very young lambic that needs some time for the sweetness to mellow out.
Bottle @ hotel in Holland. Light hazy copper pour with a small head. Notes of musty wood, dust, apple skin, light tart and some funk. Quite good!

Bottle from Berkeley Bowl West. Pours golden with a thick foamy white head and a sour fruit aroma. There is a delicate slightly sweet fruity flavor with lots of carbonation and a dry finish. Alcohol is not particularly noticeable. Nicely aged.

How: Bottle.
Where: SBWF 2016.
Appearance: Hazy dark golden colour with a whit ehead.
Aroma: Tart, citrus, sour.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Tart, fruit, citrus, sour.
Une magnfique gueuze puissant et équilibrée à la fois fruitée et tendue, avec une bouche qui laiss perplexe par sa complexité et sa longueur. Un régal de fin de soirée

Pours hazy amber with a white head. Aroma of green grapes, green apples, vinegar, funk, oak and dry champagne. Taste of funk, oak, green apples, basement, dry champagne and vinegar. Really awesome gueuze.

From bottle. Pour a hazy golden with a big white head. Aroma has oak, vanilla, vinegar, green apples, funk, grapes, super fruity. Taste is super fruity, lots of ripe apples, apple sweetness, some tartness and some dry funk. Pretty oaky and slight vinegar. High carbonation and a smooth body.
Bottle. Murky amber color. Awesome aroma: old lambic, barnyard, old cheese. Taste: malt shades, fruity, hay, citrus. Great.

375ml bottle. Pours copper gold with an off white head. Aroma is sweet and funky with oak, white grape, orange... did I mention funk? Flavor is sweet, sugary with lemon, apple tart, orange, hay. mild oak tannins in the finish. This is funky, but not as funky as the aroma suggests. Carbonation seems a bit strong.

375 ml shared by Willrunforbeer, thanks for this lambic! Nice pour shows a crystal clear orange color. Aroma is sour lemon juice, barnyard funk, rotten applesauce, and malt. 
Flavor has a sweet and sour nuances. Taste is sweet upfront, dry floral, lemon rind, light musty basement, rotten apples. Aftertaste is sweeter then I would have guessed. Interesting I guess.
Smooth sourish but a bit alcoholic sweetish with grainy hints. The high ABV is not too great for the slightly sourness and the typical aroma. Interesting.

Bottle at Cafe Sara, july 23rd 2016. Hazy golden to orange body with a tiny white head. Aroma of barnyard, citrus and wood. Taste is sour, sweat, tart farmhouse, with a mild sugary note towards the finish. Deep fruit and sourness play. Very enjoya
Bottle sample at SBWF. Pours yellow with a small white head. Really nice aroma with a nice sourness. Taste is both sour and sweet, a really nice beer!

Bottle sample at SBWF.
Pale yellow, clear.
Sour, aromatic, sweet, nice, fruity, lamic, cellar, peach.
Sample @ SBWF. A rather unbalnced geuze thats a bit too strong and bitter for my taste.

Flaska från Etre Gourmete. Gyllengul, små bubblor och lite kolsyra trots allt och ett lågt vitt skum. Djupare och sötare doft än en vanlig lambic med äpplen som fått mogna lite längre. Smaken är på samma sätt sötare och lite kryddigare och jag köper absolut bryggeriets beskrivning där "mogna äpplen, vanilj, inslag av ek, persika och muskot" ingår. Eftersmaken är kryddig och lite fatbesk och ligger kvar länge i munnen. Syran finns där men balanseras mot sötman på ett helt annat sätt än en lättare lambic och även om jag nog gillar klassisk lambic bättre så är det här också fantastiskt gott. Och det växer för varje klunk.

Bottle sample at SBWF.
Very alcoholic and sweet, a little like a malt liqour but with some funky tartness. Too much.

An slightly orange beer, a head is small and blond. Aroma has tartness, bananas, barrel, green apples, some grapes. Taste has green apples and tartness, balancing sweetness, grapes. Medium bodied, slightly sticky as typical. Great beer and balanced. Enjoyable.

Sample at SBWF 2016. 

Clear dark golden with a small head. Tart with citrus, barnyard and some malt. The body was relaxed. Refreshing and with well hidden alcohol.
Bottled at SBWF.  Clear deep golden, small head. Citric lemon aroma. Tart with light-medium body and rounded, spritzy mouthfeel. Peach and lemon, some barnyard. Low-medium bitterness.

Yellow with a pale head. Aroma is citrus zest, white wine, hint of vinegar. Light bodied, balanced on the palate - slight sweetness and nice sour. Taste is citrus zest, white wine, hints of sour stone fruits, white wine vinegar.

Bottle... Pours lightly hazy and deeply golden with a glimmer of orange and a mid-sized, off-white head. The aroma is citric and oaken with notes of barnyard funk and unidentifiable fruitiness. For the style, this is uncharacteristically full-bodied with vibrant carbonation. The flavor is lightly sour, oaken and funky, but also moderately sweet and fruity. Leaves me wishing there was more lactic acid and less sugar. Still, this is enjoyable and I appreciate the opportunity to sample it. Bottle courtesy of newcigarz!

375 mL bottle. Orange body with a medium white head and thick collar. Smells of green apples, oak, and a substantial sweetness. Tastes really oaky throughout. Green apples as well. Green apple tartness. Some vanilla from the oak. Medium heavy, especially for a lambic. Pretty sweet. Well carbonated. Its not bad, but not the most complex expression of the style and definitely too sweet for my tastes.

Small bottle in a tulip. Pours golden with a small head. Aroma of sourness/funk, some light vinegar notes, lots of oak, fruits, pale malts with almost some sweetness. Flavor a weird blend of it all. Average texture. A little too sour and too much vinegar going on here.

37.5cl bottle. Hazy golden pour with a small short-lived white head. Aroma of tart apples, funk, fruit, vinous notes. Taste is apples, peach, vinous, oak, mild funk. Finish is warm and tart but fairly sweet. Quite good.

375ml bottle. 
Deep golden with a thin white head. 
Barnyard, apricots, hay, funky aroma. 
Flavor has apples, barnyard, ripe fruits, tartness. Funky, barnyard, really tasty.

.375 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, thanks a lot! Pale orange hazy. Wonderful farmy barny nose, old straw malts, dried stone fruits. Very delicious, strong aroma. Med bodied. Soft tartness, almlst toffee- like oak. Dried fruits, old straw. Really nice drink. Well aged.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

MBR Sour Beer Fest (thanks Ludo!). Clear amber body with a small white body. Quite subdued fine funky aroma. Very soft taste, light tartness, light funk, a bit of herbal and citric notes. This is superb stuff... and when realization hits you that this is 9%... wow!
.35l bottle @Bomb. Pours hazy yellow with low head. Aroma is wine like, apple, hint of yeast, stable notes. Flavor is mostly same. Well balanced.

0.375 bottle from Alko Arkadia, Helsinki. Appearance is golden, cloud and still. Aroma has wood and butter scotch. Taste has butter scotch and vanilla from the foeder. This is not bone dry but rather mellow. Oh, no this is actually the best beer I have tasted ever so far. It is just that I liked my previous number one a lot.

23/VIII/16 - 37.5cl bottle @ home - BB: n/a (2016-913) 
Note: tasted in a vertical VAT tasting, with the 44 and 77.
Clear pinkish orange beer, big creamy solid yellowish head, little stable, non adhesive. Aroma: floral, soapy, quite some chlorine, swimming pool, men sweat, slightly fruity. MF: soft carbon, medium to full body. Taste: rather sweet start (especially after first trying the 44 and 77), overripe fruits, mainly kiwi, nice acidity, bitter touch, some green banana, bit metallic. Aftertaste: fruity, some citrus, banana, kiwi.
Hazy orange. Awesomely fruity. Spiky. Carbonated. Some yeasty. Somehow watery. Alrighty goze.

Hazy orange beer smallish head on top going to the sides of the glass. Aroma has green apples, white wine and yeast notes. Taste has sourness, green apples and some yeast with dry ending. Medium body and high carbonation.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

375mL bottle drunk 8/13/16.Clear, well-carbonated, peach-copper-golden body shows a bit more darkness of color than usual, for a gueuze. White head fizzles almost instantly, leaving a ring of bubbles.Hmmmm. Wood, saccharine sweetness, vegetal/musty cellar and some butter (though I dont think diacetyl, but what? Not sure). Very much wood/oak-derived aroma, and even malty. All very odd and unique, I guess you might say, though Im not sure in a good way...Where is the soft, brett and lacto integration/expression, where is the delicate honey and fruitiness?Again, sugary with tons of wood tannin and buttery oak. Vanilla, more honey and only light to moderate lactic acid to balance, which it does unsuccessfully, leaving the beer just too damned sweet, ultimately. And what the hell is up with the abv?? Is this aimed at a new crowd of extreme [American] beer drinkers who are turned off by the extreme sourness of traditional lambics? Cant really think of any other reason....barely seems like lambic to me.
pour yellow without head. cask aromas, light lemon, grapes, taste medium sweet medium sour, maybe to sweet. medium bodied, lively carbonation.

18.08.2016, 0,375l bottle sampled @ Café Sara:
Nice slightly fizzy-creamy shortlasting head, hazy. Aroma is sour-ish dry, old rope, minerals, oak, grass, sorrel, mild vinegar, weeds, bark, sour socks. Taste is sour-ish dry, sorrel, weeds, sour grass, oak, bark, minerals, mild vinegar, hay. Medium bitterness, slightly sour-ish dry mouthfeel. Nice.

Bouteille:Deep golden,almost clear, firm and stable off-white head; moderate to solid sourish lemony-cellary nose, some sweet and fruity malt underneath, light traces of Brett in the background; moderate sour-sweet flavour, very light bitterness underneath, medium to full bodied ; lingering sour-sweet finish with lemony,fruity, cellary and malty traces. Complex, but not too complex, and very well drinkable...
Bottle. Golden pour with white head. Sweet, malty, light funk, Apple, fruit aromas. Flavors are a touch sweet, Apple, fruit, funk, malty tones.
UPDATED: AUG 23, 2016 Bottle - pours yellow white head - nose and taste of oak, sweet grain, lemon and funk - medium body

Bottle shared with Lukasmh. Pours hazy orange with a medium white head. Aromas of deep mushroom funk, light vinegar, grapes, sweet red apples. Taste is sweet, light vinegary, sweet grapes, floral, lemony, heavy forest floor funk, sweet apples.
Side by side with Vat 77. Bottle at home. Pours orange, nose is light funk, lemon, taste is sweet, funky, tart, zesty. Not as dry as the 77.

UPDATED: AUG 12, 2016 Extremely complex aroma, sweeter than most geuzes and with a brave but contained dose of "outhouse", hints of caramel and raisins. Tastes sweetish for a geuze, but it helps increase the complexity of aroma at the expense of palate. Alcohol way more prominent than in most geuzes. I love it although it is sort of midway between geuze and oud bruin.

Golden hazy and nice head actually. Fruity and woody sourness, dank. Good rounded sourness with a slight dark caramel sweetness to back up. Fig and red wine vinegar. Like it, nice sour ale, almost Flemish brown. (From the bottle at Hapje Tapje 2016)
Bottle. Hazy amber pour with offwhite head. Aroma has rasin, apricot and citrus. Taste is very balanced and fresh. Round and refreshing. ABV gives a bit of warmth in the end. Medium body.
Bottle. Hazy amber colour. Apple and peach aroma. Sweet, apple, peach, sour taste. Medium body.

375ml bottle. Clear golden with no head. Medium body with low to moderate carbonation. Nice sourness with subtle sweet and bitter tones. Tart, oak, ripe appels, subtle vanilla and peach. Smooth and well balanced brew, especially for its 9% ABV.

RBESG 2016 in Barcelona. Shared bottle at Lambicus. Deep golden colour. Sourish farmhouse aroma. Medium sour flavour - but unfortunately served too warm, so I probably did not get the right impression. Will sample again if I can find another bottle.

Shared bottle on 9th July 2016: with the RBESG guys in Lambicus, Barcelona. Not usually a Gueuze sort of bloke but this was lovely. The cask obviously calming down the sourness during the aging process. Tart, yet with a softness not often found in Lambic styles, it slipped down far too easily and swiftly. A true classic. It was like finding a quiet oasis in the middle of a raging beer frenzy (which is what was going on at the time).

Hazy orange colour, small white off-white head. Aroma is wood, some sourness, a bit alcohol and some nice sourish notes. Flavour is tartness, yet rather sweet with some mild famwardy notes. Mild rubbery notes in the flavour as well.

Bottle from Dranken Geers, Oostakker, Nr Gent, Belgie, consumed at home Tuesday 12th July 2016   Pours deep gold with a light haze, busy carbonation and a slim white head. Fruity aroma with a bit of cheese rind, in fact its a bit like cheese on toast. Wow this is so soft and smooth, yes the sourness is there but my this wood has really softened this and made it ultra smooth and incredibly drinkable. In terms of fruit I get a little melon, its dry, a touch sweet, it leaves a blanket of soft, drying, furry funkiness across the roof of the mouth. I know for the real sour heads this may not give them the zappy, tart boost that they crave but that doesnt concern me, its so gloriously drinkable, I love this, its a stunner. A8 A4 T10 P5 Ov19 4.6
37.5 cl bottle. Pours clear and golden orange with a small white head. Dry barnyard, citrusy and dry wooden. Bitter and citric fruity. Lingering wooden, fruity finish.

(Bottle, 0.375 l - brewed on 20/10/2011 - bottled on 17/12/2104 - BB 17/12/2034, at William K Kurvi, 20160705) The beer poured golden and clear. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had tartness, fruitiness, wood and vomit. Palate was medium bodied and dry with medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, sweetness, tartness, sourness, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was tart, sweet and bitterness. A surprisingly sweet for a gueuze. Good.

A bottle from Beer Gonzo, Coventry. Rich golden colour with a lightest haze, and a thick and lasting white head. Aroma is funky, citrus fruit, and apple.The taste coder apple, slight sour and also sweet to the finish.

0.375 l bottle from finestbelgianbeers.com as VAT 79, bottled in December 2014. Clear, golden amber with a medium large, rather fluffy, slowly diminishing, white head. Sourish, quite fruity and moderately funky aroma of lemon, ripe apples, some gooseberry, oak and a touch of barnyard. Moderately sour, quite fruity and a little funky taste of ripe apples, lemon, gooseberry, a touch of rhubarb, oak and hints of barnyard, followed by a medium long, not overly tart, woody and very dry finish. Medium body, slightly spritzy, moderately effervescent and not overly astringent mouthfeel, average carbonation. This is my second monoblend from Boon, and to me the VAT 77 was nice, but this one is way better. The body is expectedly fuller than that of a regular Gueuze, and it is so drinkable because of the diminished acidity and the moderate carbonation. The fruity flavours are more pronounced and easier to get and not hidden behind overpowering sourness.
0,375 l pullo jaettu @ OPP. Sameahko, kauniin meripihkan ruskea. Tuoksussa happamuutta, käyneitä omenia, mallasta. Maussa hapanta omenaa, mallasta. Ihan ok, lambicit ei yleensä itseäni säväytä.
0,375l bottle shared with friends @ One Pint Pub. Pours cloudy golden with a low head. Aroma is tarty malts and sour apples. Flavor is tarty malts, apples and oak. Very nice.

from 37,5cl bottle. poured a deeper orange colour with a white head on top. nose has that clear spiced boon funk, with bright green apples, and citrus nose shining through. old wet cellar and dusty cow webs, as it warms theres a slight sweet stone fruit finish aswell.the only bad part for me on this brew is that the 9% abv is very noticeable, slight hot finish. but overall this is quite enjoyable

Bottle from 17/12/2014. 

AROMA :Oaky, fruity, mellow, sweet. Candy floss.

APPEARANCE: Turbid, peachy coloured. Medium head and lacing.

TASTE: A synergy of flavours which make it hard to define although there was certainly a lot of stone fruits in there along with a taste of peach, oak, vanilla and marzipan to name a few. Complex stuff. 

PALATE: Really refreshing, some tannins and a slick oily mouthfeel. Medium carbonation. 

OVERALL: A really incredible synergy of flavours from this oaken cask make for one hell of a complex beer which to me is in a league of its own. One of the best Ive had.
Bottle thanks to Grant. Pours a cloudy gold with creamy white head that lasts. The aroma is strong funk, rubber, wood. Medium mouth, strong funk, apple skin, oak, rubber, very good.

Orange, slightly hazy with a loose white head. Well carbonated, zesty mouth feel. Aroma does start with barnyard funk, then sourness, both subtle, then its sweeter and fruity. Flavour is sweety, malty, full of fruit including peach, lemon and gooseberry. Dry finish. Getting some notes from the wood but theyre not overpowering either. Very good.

Koperkleurig bier met weinig wit schuim. Geur: limoen, cola zonder gas, vineus. Smaak: malse geuze, zurig maar ook zoetigheid, karamel en redelijk wat hout. Medium koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: zurig, mango. Spijtig genoeg redelijk duur bier, maar o zo lekker!

Bottle. I expected this to be all over the place rather soon, but it took me a while to get one. Think I paid to much (10.5 EUR for a 37.5 in a bottle shop !) but if its from the same level as the 77 was, I am more than happy to pay this kind of money. I even skipped it on purpose on Zythos to have a full bottle to try later on :) 


Pours unclear blonde, small white head. Smell is rather intense, and to the dry side. Some funk, and wood. Reminding me of an american sour-like lactic sourness, but in a very smooth way. Taste is intense, rather dry, very malty, somewhat fruity again , just like the 77 . The oak is strong in this one ! Beforehand, i heard many, many times this is not sour to even people calling it sweet. i do taste sourness though, but Ill agree its very smooth. To be honest, I love it, and it is weird to me, since I hear mostly negativity about it. Sure, it might not be the sourness you expect in a geuze, but not having a really sour beer, doesnt make it taste bad at all. 
I should look out for cheaper bottles, and buy more of this stuff. I love the intensity of the wood here ! 77 Still wins for me, but this one isnt all to far behind!

375 ml. bottle drank 1/3rd at t Antwaerps Bierhuyske. Bottle says 85 % old lambiek. 4 year old lambiek blended with you lambiek vs. 3 year old etc. of the Vat 44 & Vat 77. Pours a dark clear orange with basically no head. Nose is very mellow, old mellow lemon & lemon juice lambic, mellow lemon sour, easy with no raw barn or funk character no flaws of young lambiek. Taste is more akin to a pleasant, clean & mellow old lambiek than a gueze, easy lemon & lemon, faint green apple, no real funk, raw cellar etc. qualities, just pleasant easy lemon, clean, little carbonation. Pleasant easy old lambiek for me basically, like it more than the 77 but less than the 44 one, they are hard to compare due to bit non-gueze character here.

New Boon Mono Blend, this one with 90% old lambic from the oldest barrel in the brewery, barrel number 79 - sparks curiosity. Off-white, loose, bubbly head thinning quickly, only loosely retaining on the edge; beautifully warm, almost bay-like, amberish orange blonde robe, initially clear but evidently misty with the sediment added, with lively sparkling as expected from the style. Aroma has all the lambic funkiness you would expect, but in a mellow, noble, restrained, indeed largely old lambic way; hints of crabapple, moldy orange, damp wood, moist cellar, unripe apricot, yellow plum, subtle vanilla-ish oak tannins, stale sweat, sweet pickled gherkin, smelly abbey cheese, chlorine, soft lemony accent. Same mellow old lambic effect in the mouth: lots of unripe stonefruit tartness in the onset, palpable minerals and a lemony accent, sour like gooseberries or green plums: tart and crisp, but not puckering. Sedate lactic sourness rules here, dries the mouth and sharpens the appetite, but there is very little lemony acidity; mouthfeel is supple and smooth, well-carbonated but in a lambrusco-like way and therefore light and agreeably spritzy. Soft barley breadiness and wheat soapiness as in any traditional geuze form a solid backbone upon which increasing woodiness is built, assisting the lactic sourness in drying the mouth cavity and yielding lovely, noble wet wood flavor retronasally. I also recognize a vague chlorine-like effect which I have encountered in a much more outspoken (and, frankly, unpleasant) form in a glass of old Boon lambic I had at the Verzekering Tegen De Grote Dorst last year. An earthy, dim, leafy hop bitterness lingers after swallowing, actually quite outspokenly so; bready, yeasty and malty sweetishness (in the vaguest kind of way) lends juiciness to the finish and, unsurprisingly seen its unusually high ABV, a glow of soft, lightly wodka-like warming alcohol is noticeable too, but otherwise stays quite well hidden. Mellow in its sourness, a bit chlorine-like, much stronger and more bitter than average, this is quite different from the other Boon geuzes and notably different from its VAT 77 predecessor. I prefer geuze with more crispness and vivid acidity, but I like traditional geuze no matter what and this is, though not my favorite even among Boons products, certainly an interesting experiment - and a good way to get acquainted with Boons old lambic character without actually having to drink it.
Bottle at latvia beer festival, riga. Hazy orange color, white head. Aroma has peach, sour notes, some stables. Balanced sour peach taste, oaky notes, sour, earthy notes.

Bottle shared at THT. Hazy golden amber with a small off white head. Aroma of citrus, barnyard funk, oak, dank cellar and malty notes. Flavour is light to moderate, moderate bitter and light moderate sour. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Too much alcohol for the style and it shows, it starts of great in the nose but not so pleasant to actually drink.

Sampled from bottle at THT May. Hazy orange with white head. Hay, grapes, cobwebs, apricot, apples, peach, herbs. Sweet softened sour and light minerallike saltiness. Medium body, chalkiness, minerallike. Nice!

Bottle at THT May. Murky dark golden with white head. Sour grapes, lots of hay, grassy, funk, old wood. Theres a lot of herbs and grass in here, like a just mowed field drying in the sun. Some lemon and light lactic notes. Under medium sour and sweet with lasting bitter finish. Over medium bodied. This is quite nice but like most higher ABV lambic beers it leaves something left to desire.

37.5cl bottle shared at the May THT.
Thin ring white head. hazy golden pour. Some barrel notes
oro velata elegante legno liquorosa frutta secca buona acidita ma quasi bilanciata

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2017 9% ABV, brassata il 19 e 20 ottobre 2011, imbottigliata il 17 dicembre 2014, aperta il 13 maggio 2016.
Dorata opalescente, riflessi dorati, schiuma bianca fine ma non molto persistente che forma un anello lungo la parete del bicchiere.
Aroma di cuoio, polvere, legno umido di cantina, leggere note terrose che richiamano alla mente un terreno argilloso, note erbacee amare selvatiche che possono ricordare un asparago misto a basilico e rucola, finocchio fresco molto volatile, note oleose, kiwi, mela verde, uva bianca e banana lievemente acerba. 
Al palato uva bianca, kiwi, intermezzo metallico, finale caratterizzato da banana, barrique, cuoio e note di cantina misti ad un erbaceo che ricorda un asparago.
Retrolfatto principalmente di kiwi.
Corpo medio, non molto carbonata, texture oleosa.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2016 Aromat śliczny, bardzo dziki i funkowy, skóra i agrest uderza w nozdrza, ale mamy też pewne słodkie nuty dojrzałych winogron oraz kwaśne jabłka. Smak zadziwiająco zbalansowany. Kwaśność stosunkowo niska ( jak na lambika, bo to nadal głównie kwach), średnio wytrawne z całkiem niezłą słodyczą oraz lekką goryczką w posmaku. Bardzo blisko mu do niemieckich białych win. W smaku mamy ogrom winogron, agrestu, lekko funkowej mokrej skóry, moreli, przejrzałej pomarańczy, ziół. W posmaku lekko cierpko, wytrawnie i goryczkowo, z ziołami, skórką winogrona i szczyptą alkoholu. Ciało pełne, piwo zadziwiająco gładkie i kremowe, niskie wysycenie. 
Świetne piwo. Dobrze pokazuje że można zrobić wino robiąc piwo.

Sample from a 37.5cl bottle at Nacht van de Grote Dorst 2016 in Itterbeek (22 IV 2016), shared with friends. Golden to brownish coloured tart yet very mild monoblend. The funky geuze flavours are present, the soft mouthfeel is full of taste with almost sour-fruit aromas. This all without being too sweet. Very well balanced and very enjoyable.

750 ml bottle @ Nacht van de Grote Dorst 2016. Unclear, golden orange body with a medium sized, lacing white head. Classic geuze aroma with barnyard, funk and acidic fruit. Flavor is classic as well, but relatively mild and smooth compared with Tilquin for example. It actually feels almost sweet compared with Tilquin. Fine body, balanced in flavor, very likeable. Could actually have some more acidity imo.
Hazy blond colour. Aroma of sharp grape juice. The flavour is quite sour and fruity. Just enough sweetness to offer balance.

Assaggio da 100ml allo Zythos Beer Festival 2016:

Incredibile gueze. Magistrale nel bilanciamento e nella potenza alcolica e aromatica.
Al naso si sprigionano sentori di vino rosso, aceto, e uva.
In bocca si fa strada un piacevole aroma di pompelmo.
La birra è di color ambrato medio, con schiuma assente dopo il lungo invecchiamento.
La bevuta è equilbrata lungo tutta la bevuta.
Clear golden liquid, no head. Aroma of fruits. Light body, little bit carbonation. Taste is sour and fruity.
Dark yellow lightly clody white foam. Bret,sour, fruit in the aroma. Sweet, fruity milfly sour, a bit bitter in the aftertaste
Een heerlijke zachte geuze . Mooie geur. De kleur is blond goud . Licht schuimpje en beetje zoet
